title_sort: walt whitman to alma and john h. johnston, 4 march 1885
title: Walt Whitman to Alma and John H. Johnston, 4 March 1885
text: 328 Mickle StreetCamden New JerseyMarch 4 '85My dear friendsYour letter comforts & touches me deeply, & I am not sure but it w'd be a good arrangement not only for me, but all 'round—But for the present I shall keep on here—Since you was here, Alma, I have had a friend move in, Mrs. Davis, strong & hearty & good natured, a widow, young enough, furnishes me my meals, & takes good care—I am feeling quite well for me as I write this. —Soon as you get this write me how John is getting along—Last Saturday's Critic has a piece about my home which may interest you—I have been under the weather myself for nearly a fortnight, but am now all right—I shall never forget your kindness & generosity to me—I am in good spirits as I finish this, feeling better to-day than for some time past—Love to Al and May & allWalt Whitman Walt Whitman to Alma and John H. Johnston, 4 March 1885
